text: If you are a Top Internal Mutual Fund Wholesaler and are frustrated or looking for a change, we might have the next step in your career.
We are looking to hire a Hybrid Mutual Fund Wholesaler to join our firm and grow with us.
Within a relatively short period of time you might be promoted to an External Wholesaler.
The ideal candidate will have a strong work ethic, a passion for sales and building relationships, with the interest of expanding their career in the same field.

About Zacks Investment Management:

Since 1993, Zacks Investment Management has managed assets for pension funds, institutions and the HNW market.
In total ZIM manages close to $9 Billion of domestic equity, international and long / short portfolios.

As a noted investment research firm and the #2 largest provider of independent research in the United States, the parent company Zacks Investment Research was formed in 1978 to compile, analyze, and distribute brokerage research to both institutional and individual investors.
The guiding principle behind our work is the belief that earning estimate revisions are among the most potent forces in determining the future direction of stock prices.

Day to day responsibilities of the Hybrid Wholesaler will include:

Work directly with an External Wholesaler to help raise assets in the wirehouse, independent, & bank channels.

Maintain and grow new relationships within your assigned territoryProspect for new business opportunities by phone and emailSchedule meetings/appointments for External partnersSell Zacks investment strategies to financial advisorsTravel required - around 50%.

Compensation:

Generous Base Salary and Commissions (uncapped)Let's make sure it's a right fit first before talking numbers...

Job Requirements:

3 years minimum successful experience as a TOP INTERNAL or Hybrid in the mutual fund wholesale industryA bachelor degree in a business related field is strongly recommendedSeries 7 (or Series 6), Series 63, Series 65 or Series 66 (preferred)A working knowledge and passion for the equity marketsProficient computer skills in Microsoft Excel, officeAbility to travel, as needed

If interested, please submit your resume and a brief summary describing your experience related to this position and why you think you'd be the best candidate.

Software Quality Assurance Engineer (Job Number:437995)Description:JOB DESCRIPTION:Candidate serves as a Product and Process Compliance professional responsible for ensuring the integrity, reliability and reproducibility of our software, documentation and processes used to produce the end product.
As a member of the SAIC software team, duties include product/process audits, traceability audits, root cause analysis and compliance reporting.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:- Determine the degree to which the software products and related documentation conform to established requirements.- Identify required software products and documentation.- Identify the requirements allocated to the software products and related documentation.- Evaluate (validate, verify or review) the results of the allocation process.- Evaluate (validate, verify or review) software products or documentation for conformance against established software requirements- Non-conformances are raised when software products or documentation do not conform to established software requirements.- Prior to delivery, determine the degree of confidence the organization has that the established requirements are satisfied and that the software products and related documentation will be acceptable to the customer.- Collect measurement data sufficient to support satisfaction and acceptability decisions.- Owner and executor of the product acceptance criteria.- Identify criteria for product acceptance.

These conditions may be derived from a contract, project plans, documentation, SQA reports and other sources.- Ensure the organization and the customer understand these conditions.- Determine whether the product conforms to contracts and documented acceptance requirements.- Prior to delivery of the software products, the products conformance to the organizations understanding of conditions for product acceptance is confirmed.- Non-conformances are raised when software products do not conform to established software requirements.- Determine whether the product support requirements identified in the project plans are consistent with the contract and clearly identify the responsibilities of both the organization and the customer.- Analyze contracts and project plans to identify the required level of support.- Review customer support plans and determine whether the level of customer support is consistent with contractual or agreed upon support requirements.- Identify SQA requirements and include them in the Software Quality Assurance Plan (SQAP).- Monitor activities and raise non-conformances when these activities are not performed as defined in the plan.- Measure and evaluate, on a regular basis, the level of support and cooperation with respect to the product support plan and identify issues.- Determine whether product measurements demonstrate the quality of the products and conform to standards and procedures established by the project.- Identify the standards and procedures established by the organization.- Determine whether proposed measurements are consistent with standards and procedures established by the project.- Determine whether the proposed product measurements are representative of product quality attributes.- Analyze product measurement results to identify gaps and recommend improvements to close gaps between measurements and expectations.- Evaluate product measurement results to determine whether improvements implemented as a result of product quality measurements are effective.- Analyze product measurement procedures to confirm they are sufficient to satisfy the measurement requirements defined in the projects processes and plans.- Other duties as assigned.- *Must be a US Citizen**Qualifications:CLEARANCE REQUIREMENTS:- Must be able to obtain and maintain a secret security clearanceREQUIRED EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, AND SKILLS:- Must have at least a Bachelor s Degree in software or computer engineering field or computer science with course work related to software engineering.- Preferred Master of Software Engineering with course work related software process/product compliance and release management.- Must have excellent problem solving, interpersonal communication and project management skills.

DESIRED EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, AND SKILLS:- Experience with developing or modifying software product/process compliance and quality assurance plans, policies, and procedures tailored to the complexity and scope of the developmental or operational system.- Experience with implementation and administration of product/process compliance and software quality assurance metrics, such as defect profiles and performance to entry/exit criteria.- Experience with Linux and/or QNX required, other embedded OS experience strongly desired - preferably command line and not just GUI desktop usage.- Experience with software industry best practices like Capability Maturity Model Integrated at least level 3 standards.- Knowledge of implementing the software quality assurance discipline for the entire life cycle of systems from initial requirements and capabilities baselines to system end-of-life.- Knowledge of Lean/Six-Sigma principles and practices.- Knowledge of software engineering and lifecycle management standards, regulations, processes and best practices.- Skill in defining, implementing and executing software quality best practices and procedures to design, influence, and drive quality and testing of our software.- Ability to apply concepts and define and implement software quality assurance processes and procedures.- Ability to inspire team confidence and respect while motivating team members in a creative and effective manner.- Ability to review functional and technical documentation from requirements.- Ability to review source code against chosen coding standards.

WATCH YOUR CUSTOMERS GROW  ALONG WITH YOUR CAREER  Small to medium-sized business owners are ready for tech-based solutions that give them an edge-and that's exactly what you'll offer as a Business Account Executive for Comcast Business Services.
Our integrated suite of Internet, phone, Ethernet and TV products and services are tailor-made for up-and-coming businesses in every type of industry.
So you're not just selling; you're collaborating and playing an active role in your customers' future success.
You'll be listening and effectively responding to client challenges in this customer-facing outside sales role as you create the right bundle of products and services to help each unique customer.

Other responsibilities include generating new sales leads largely in person with some communication over the phone; creating/delivering compelling sales presentations to your prospects; and developing partnerships/affiliations with local organizations.

As you grow your business via client referrals and canvassing your territory, you'll become an expert on the local competitive landscape; and be able to meet or exceed your sales goals, objectives and business relationships.
We'll provide in-depth and ongoing training on the full range of Comcast products and services to ensure your success.
In return you'll bring strong persuasive, negotiation and follow-up skills to the mix, along with a proven ability to successfully close a sale.
A high school diploma or the equivalent is required; a bachelor's degree and 1-2 years of related sales experience is preferred.
If you'd enjoy being part of a close-knit, results-driven team with exceptional potential for growth, we'd like to hear from you.
To learn more about this and other exciting opportunities, use the link below to review the full job description, including experience requirements, and complete an application.
Comcast is an EOE/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT employer

Job DescriptionLiberty Communications is seeking a talented Account Executive (Outside Sales Representative) to join our growing team.
The Account Executive is responsible for the prospecting, engagement, cultivation, and maintenance of the client relationship.

Founded in 2006, Liberty Communications (LC) is a verified Woman-Owned Enterprise (WBE), Minority Business Enterprise (WBE), Disabled Business Enterprise (WBE), and a Small Business Enterprise (SBE) serving Colorados front range in the telecommunications and IT field and headquartered in Westminster, CO.
LC offers local customer service, training and support combined with an extensive array of leading communication industry products and services.
Liberty serves both public and private sector entities throughout Colorado and the Rocky Mountain Region.
You must have exceptional hunting skills, using both traditional methods (calls, networking, referrals, cold -call drop-ins, etc.)
as well as using social media and LinkedIn.
You regularly find, contact and close ideal, hard to reach clients and C-Level decision makers that are bombarded by similar offers on a regular basis.
You are able to close new business on your own with minimal direction and limited resources.
You have had success selling on value, not price.
You understand, and have sold, multi-year services with recurring revenue.
You must be a highly motivated, confident self-starter used to over-achieving goals.
You are intrinsically motivated, with a strong work ethic and are comfortable effectively handing off to our operations team once the sale has closed.
You are effective at overcoming resistance and are comfortable in a structured sales environment with regular results reporting requirements.
You must be skilled at building relationships and have a gift for high level consultative sales.
You quickly understand complex businesses from multiple industry groups and are able to diagnose problems, uncover pain points, and solve unique problems.
You must be a clear, concise, and persuasive communicator, able to connect with broad internal and external audiences.
You must have great listening skills and strong verbal, non-verbal, and written business communications acumen.
You should be optimistic and excited to join a growing company with a great team.
You are persistent, driven to succeed, committed to do (ethically) whatever it takes to succeed.
You must present yourself professionally in all ways and all times and be accountable to your goals.

Responsibilities



Profile prospects in the target demographics and industry groups assigned by LC
Cultivate successful long-term relationships to expand the LC client base
Actively participate in all sales team training events
Learn telecom product specifications to relay critical site requirements ot the LC technical implementation team
Exhibit superior customer service and facilitate product support and client training throughout engagement
Collaborate daily with the in-office and technical installation team to ensure delivery on client needs
Work closely with Account Managers to ensure customer expectations are fully achieved
Attend and actively participate in multiple networking groups to spread the LC footprint and be a brand evangelist
Track daily sales activities and review coaching recommendations throughout the sales process
Relentlessly enter and update all prospects and customer data in the sales CRM
Schedule and conduct strategic partnership meetings to expand mutually beneficial relationships


Required Skills



Competitive and performance-oriented individual who is driven to achieve goals
High energy and a strong consultative sales mindset
Self-starter that takes action without being instructed
Strong interpersonal skills in influencing decision makers
Persistence and superb follow up
Good verbal, non-verbal, and written business communication skills


Qualifications



Bachelor's Degree
Prior experience in consultative outside sales is REQUIRED.
Experience in telecom/IT is preferred.

Compensation



$65,000 base salary (for first 3 months, $50k base thereafter) plus commission and bonus opportunity for a total OTE of $100,000

Job Description:

Employer ranks in the top 40 on LinkedIn's 2017 "Top Companies" list.
We offer challenging and meaningful problems, a collaborative culture, and support for your career goals and growth.
We are seeking talented Software Engineers to join our team in enhancing our live streaming video applications and services, which are in active use by our global customers.
This opportunity could be located in Dayton, OH or Charlottesville, VA.

JOB SUMMARY:

You will help build and maintain our live streaming video applications for video analysts.

Because our team works with a variety of languages (C++, Java, Javascript, Python) and technologies (Docker, Puppet, NiFi, etc), we are less concerned with specific skills than proven technical problem solving abilities.

Help us achieve our vision: sub-second latency for live video delivery and playback in both desktop and browser-based clients, with pluggable, horizontally scalable backend components supporting ingest, variable bit rates, and analyst workflows.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:



Design, develop, and debug mission critical software source code.
Participate in the full software development lifecycle.
Research and integrate new technologies into our development and production systems.
Write and prototype API specifications for Test-Driven Development.
Serve as technical lead for small projects and mentor other engineers.
Work on the hardest open problems in live-streamed video.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:- Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field and a minimum of 5 years of software engineering experience (experience may be considered in lieu of a degree).- Strong proficiency using at least one high-level programming language (Java, C++, etc.).- Knowledge of Agile Development methodologies.- Familiarity with basic web technologies including HTML, CSS, XML, SOAP, WSDL, REST, JSON, and JavaScript.- Demonstrable problem solving skills.
SECURITY CLEARANCE REQUIREMENTS: U.S. citizenship and the ability to obtain a TS/SCI clearance.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:



Experience with Test-Driven Development.
Familiarity with at least one Relational Database Management System (Oracle, MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server, etc.).
Familiarity with NoSql databases (Apache Accumulo, MongoDB, etc.).
Experience with Spring or video transcoding.
Prior work or hobbyist projects with ffmpeg, libdash, or angular.js.
QT and/or web graphical user interface development experience.

ABOUT HESS CORPORATION  Hess is a leading international independent energy company engaged in the exploration and production of crude oil and natural gas.
We have an industry leading position in the Bakken in North Dakota a key U.S. shale play.
Hess is also one of the largest producers in the deepwater Gulf of Mexico and a key natural gas producer and supplier to Peninsular Malaysia and Thailand.

The company is engaged in exploration and appraisal activities offshore Guyana, participating in one of the industry's largest oil discoveries in the past decade, as well as the Gulf of Mexico, Suriname and Nova Scotia.
Hess aims to attract, retain and energize the best people by investing in their professional development and providing them with challenging and rewarding opportunities for personal growth.
We are always looking for talented professionals who share our values and are passionate about making a difference in the world and in their careers.

We strive to meet the highest standards of corporate citizenship by protecting the health and safety of our employees, safeguarding the environment and creating a long-lasting, positive impact on the communities where we do business.
For more information about Hess Corporation, please visit our website at Hess.com.

The source of data includes but is not limited to leases, contracts, division orders, title opinions, curative and other such related documents.
This position requires someone skilled in all facets of ownership including various interaction levels with internal and external business partners.

Contract administration.

In-depth knowledge in PRA/SAP Ownership Modules Advanced analytical skills.
Advanced computer skills, specifically Microsoft Excel   Competencies  The Hess Way of Working refers to competencies considered absolute pre-requisites for success.

Description We are looking for a data savvy, strategic 'thought partner', to join the Relationship Management team within Clinical Analysis as the analytic touch point.
In this role, you will help our clinical leaders use data to drive insights in order to improve the lives of thousands of vulnerable New Yorkers.

As a Relationship Manager, you will be a champion for the analytic and reporting needs of various Clinical departments, building effective working relationships with our business partners, and immersing yourself in their strategic vision.
You will attend stakeholder meetings, serving as the voice of Clinical Analysis, and oversee a dynamic portfolio of projects within your client group.
Within the Clinical Analysis team you will work closely with others to get work done (including our analyst pool, data science arm, and innovation lab).

Examples of initiatives you may work on include: targeting members at high risk for avoidable admissions, evaluating the effectiveness of care management programs, and designing dashboards to track and trend quality rates.

Translate business needs into requests for actionable analysis by others, including documenting user stories and/or writing (light weight) tech specs Drive towards a culture of accountability through constant prioritization, organization and assessment of work in order to meet the needs of our clinical partners Share your subject matter expertise for your assigned clinical area with others on our team, including guiding less experience analysts to help them complete their work Oversee the creation and maintenance of essential operational and analytical dashboards, and update and enhance them as our user's needs evolve Use data to tell a story that our doctors, nurses and social workers will be able to understand, including packaging and presenting findings in a clear, concise, and compelling manner Exhibit an awareness of our technology stack which includes Tableau, R, Alteryx, Python, SAS, and AWS Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in healthcare, business, technology, or quantitative field Minimum of 2 years of prior experience working in healthcare, business or analysis and reporting.
Preferred Qualifications: Graduate degree in Public Health or Business Administration and/or background in Population Health or quality improvement.
Prior experience working with Tableau or other visualization tools.
Excellent presentation and communication skills, comfortable presenting in front of others.
Highly organized with the ability to juggle multiple projects at once and meet aggressive deadlines.
Previous experience with project management tools and approaches such as Agile or Kanban.

Self-directed logic thinker who enjoys working with others to improve healthcare outcomes Works well under pressure with an ability to cope in a fast paced environment and meet aggressive deadlines WE ARE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER.

Duties include:

 Reviewing documents, web pages, and eLearning materials for Section 508 compliance.
Testing documents, web pages, and eLearning content for 508 compliance.
Updating content and/or providing guidance to resolve 508 compliance issues.

 3-5+ years of preparing, testing, and correcting content for 508 compliance.
Ability to perform complete audits and validation testing on documents, web pages, and eLearning materials based upon Section 508 accessibility guidelines.
Experience testing documents (PDF, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) for Section 508 compliance.
Knowledge on how to create 508 compliant source files and advise on accessibility and other issues in advance.

Job DescriptionCCBHC Care Coordination is responsible for the coordination and managing of care across the spectrum of health care services, including access to high quality physical health (both acute and chronic,) and behavioral health care, as well as social services, housing, educational systems, and employment opportunities as necessary to facilitate wellness and the recovery of the whole person.
Care coordination services are provided to all eligible CCBHC individuals regardless of insurance status.

The Care Coordinator at CCBHC will ensure seamless care coordination for individuals referred to and/or returning from a higher level of care such as hospitals, inpatient units or residential settings.
The Care Coordinator acts as a liaison between agencies to ensure that coordination of care is seamless.

The Care Coordinator will work as part of a specialty team to assist CCBHC enrolled individuals in access and linkage to needed community resources to ensure optimal engagement in the recovery process.

Bachelors Degree in a behavioral health and/ or related human services field preferred
Life experience in navigating the behavioral health and other service systems preferred
Experience with providing care coordination in a health care and or human service field for individuals requiring access and linkage to needed resources.
Must understand and have experience in navigating social service systems ie Physical health, education, employment, housing, insurance etc.

Must demonstrate a genuine respect for all individuals presenting at the CCBHC and be willing to work with diverse population with multi systemic needs
Must be comfortable utilizing NETs electronic health record(EHR) for documentation of service delivery
Must demonstrate an understanding of cultural competence and be able to develop supportive and trusting relationship with individuals needing assistance
Must be willing to participate in NETs CCBHC training to ensure knowledge and skills comply with quality standard expectations


ESSENTIAL POSITION REQUIREMENTS:

Must demonstrate genuine empathy and concern for individuals as indicated in our corporate vision, mission, and values statements.
Adhere to applicable city, county, state, and federal laws and regulations, internal and CCBHC standards.
Must have current State clearances for Child Abuse, Criminal Records, and Contagious Diseases.
Must possess strong interpersonal and organizational skills.
Must be able to work independently and as part of a care coordination team.

Must document all service within NETs CCBHC Electronic Health Record (EHR)

PREFERRED POSITION REQUIREMENTS:

Since travel may be required, it is preferred that the candidate has a Valid Drivers License (issued by state in which employee lives) and a safe driving record and proof of insurance coverage.

ESSENTIAL POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:



Coordination, processing, and follow-up of insurance documents required to secure insurance for those individuals uninsured.

To include: COMPASS online enrollment and completion of Medical Assessment Form


  Liaisons with the Welfare Office in reference to insurance status of CCBHC individuals

  Coordination of access and linkage to significant resources impacting treatment as identified in the preliminary screening process i.e housing, primary care physician, etc.

Facilitation of crises intervention action during the preliminary screening as directed by Clinical Supervisor

  Coordinate access to medical and/or other treatment services as needed by the individual

  Responsible for client/family outreach communication in all matters surrounding the coordination of services

  Responsible to assist client and families in accessing community support and resources

  Responsible to advocate on behalf of client needs

  Responsible to assure ongoing communication and integration of services among all service providers and support systems involved with the child, adolescent, adult, and family

  Responsible to document all communication and service provision in NETs Electronic Health Record(EHR)

  Responsible to reviews and track admissions and discharges from different levels of care via secure fax, secure email, telephone, and electronic portals determined by the capabilities individual external agencys capacity

b. document contact in consumers electronic chart c. reconcile medication from hospital

Other duties as assigned or required.

Care Coordination service provision is primarily office based and will require both face to face and phone contact with individuals presenting and eligible for CCBHC services.

Daily project management of key initiatives, including status updates, reviews and other required communications
Demonstrated leadership and influencing skills, including good decision making and ability to work independently
Strong verbal and written communication skills; ability to communicate with all levels of management and ability to work across a variety of cross-functional teams
Team-oriented with the ability to adapt to changing business priorities and schedules; ability to manage multiple deliverables at the same time
CIB Markets & Investor Services Business Knowledge is a plus
At least three years of related analytical experience, with finance experience preferred
Excellent computer skills including Excel, Word, Project, PowerPoint, Access, Cognos, SQL and SharePoint; prior experience with Qlikview, Business Objects and Hyperion Essbase are a plus
Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, Mathematics or related discipline required.

Position Summary

The Administrative Director will be responsible for supporting the delivery of a holistic, outstanding, and distinctive student experience across a portfolio of programs so that students have a seamless and integrated high-quality experience.

The Administrative Director will ensure that the  voice of the student  is at the forefront in the delivery of programs; seeking and listening to feedback from students, alumni, mentors, and staff about the quality of the program experience and will surface any points of friction to the portfolio leadership team.
The Program Portfolio Manager will own the student success metrics within their portfolio.

Position Scope

First level Director within a function; has breadth and depth of expertise, gained through wide-ranging experience and has expert-level knowledge, experience and skills related to the function and organization - Demonstrates competencies and achieves work through managers - Establishes and/or contributes to development of functional goals, plans and practices - Assists Company Leaders in defining strategic plans - Accountable for group budget - Operates as a leader, is a role model to others, and champions company direction and standards - Is well networked in the organization - Invests in improving the organization

Essential Functions and Responsibilities


Serves as a key liaison for a specified portfolio between the programs and key college and university stakeholders

Participates in and contributes to regular staff, department and meetings with college partners as appropriate.
Represents their portfolio at meetings related to the student experience.

Focuses on the entire arc of the student s program portfolio experience -- from prospect to alumni -- to ensure that we are delivering programs that are seamless, frictionless, and deliver on our student promise of degree and career success.

The Administrative Director will have a unique holistic view of the student s program experience within their assigned portfolio, which puts him/her in the position to suggest and lead pilot studies within the portfolio, suggest amendments to policies and procedures, suggest and collaborate with Program Development on revisions to playbooks, and take the lead on implementation of innovations.

Plays a key role in reviewing the support provided by the Student Support Centers to ensure that the support, learning resources, and/or tutoring is meeting the needs of the students in his/her portfolio.
Maintains a solid understanding of college and institutional goals and priorities as they relate to the student experience.
Implements program-level initiatives that optimize the program s outcomes and ultimately improve the student s program experience.
Administrative Director will be expected to ensure integration and coordination of any new programs and services with programs currently being offered by the college and university.
Highly knowledgeable of the unique needs of WGU students particularly in the areas of student engagement, student retention and student satisfaction.
He/she must be confident using this knowledge to inform strategy development and ongoing evolution.
Knowledgeable and up to date on current WGU Institutional Research including the university surveys, college specific surveys and the National Survey of Student Engagement (NSSE).
Uses current research to design intentional, proactive and responsive programs that are in line with the needs of our students and faculty partners.
Confident reading and interpreting statistical information and data relevant to the student experience.

Required SkillsRequired Education and Experience


Master s degree preferred in Counseling, Higher Education Administration, Student Personnel, Business, Human Resources or related discipline or Bachelor s degree required and 5 years experience outlined in the Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Experience developing, delivering and evaluating strategies at post-secondary institutions

Experience with successful collaboration across multiple departments and proven ability to produce results to operational improvements that impact the student experience.

Program/project management experience is an asset

Required Skills


Proven ability to take initiative and be both creative and flexible.
Strong oral and written communication skills, solid organizational skills, and sound judgment.

Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively, build consensus and be sensitive to the needs and interests of various stakeholders, and contribute to the functioning of a diverse team both within the college and across the institution.
Demonstrated ability to contribute to and thrive in a collaborative environment and to apply a positive team approach to working with colleagues.
Demonstrated ability to use and interpret data to make decisions, and communicate results effectively to various stakeholders.
Able to build collaborative working relationships across the university.
The Program Experience Manager will be required to lead colleagues and university stakeholders in understanding the student experience.
Teamwork skills are crucial as is consensus building and strategic leadership.

Highly knowledgeable in best practices, literature and research on the needs of students at post-secondary institutions and have a strong understanding of the unique needs of WGU students including graduate and undergraduate students

Strong commitment to Competency Based Education
